content.body:
> <@rkirsling:matrix.org> have hosts at other orgs needed to struggle to get an AV setup realized -- specifically, wrt to ensuring that local and remote audio are adequately integrated?

For Helsinki I ended up buying all of the audio gear (except the cables, those I got from the university), because that was cheaper and more convenient than renting. Total cost was somewhere around EUR 1200. To make that work, I got a mixer board with 12 inputs and separate outputs for the in-room speakers and the sound card of the laptop connected to zoom.

For Helsinki I ended up buying all of the audio gear (except the cables, those I got from the university), because that was cheaper and more convenient than renting. Total cost was somewhere around EUR 1200. To make that work, I got a mixer board with 12 inputs and separate outputs for the in-room speakers and the sound card of the laptop connected to zoom.
